definition: to act as a matchmaker
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: Now the United manager claims forces in the press are deliberately trying to undermine De Gea.
sentences.chinese: 現在曼聯經理說媒體正在對德赫亞施加壓力。

definition: lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
a short time/a little while
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to hug/to embrace
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
from the start/absolutely/entirely/simply
foolish talk/nonsense
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
willingly and gladly (idiom)
marriage by capture/bride kidnapping
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: (coll.) lowest-ranking (student, participant etc)/to rank at the bottom of the list/to finish last
